snippet: Trustees of the New York Public Library on Wednesday agreed to begin using part of the $150 million in city funds allocated to pay for part of the cost of renovating its main branch on Fifth Avenue.
abstract: Trustees of the New York Public Library on Wednesday agreed to begin using part of the $150 million in city funds allocated to pay for part of the cost of renovating its main branch on Fifth Avenue.

headline.main: New York Public Library to Begin Spending City Funds on Renovation
headline.print_headline: Library Moves Ahead With Its Renovation Plans
